intro: Thlaspi schrankii, commonly known as Schrank's cabbagewort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous species. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. It produces small, yellow flowers and has a rosette of basal leaves. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
